conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force on the object as it is transported from point M to point N.
Calculate the frictional force f using f = mu * m * g, resulting in f = 9 N.
Determine the acceleration a of the object using a = f / m, resulting in a = 3 m/s^2.
Calculate the time t taken for the object to reach the speed of the conveyor belt using t = v / a, resulting in t = 2 s.
Determine the distance d traveled by the object during acceleration using d = 0.5 * a * t^2, resulting in d = 6 m.
Calculate the remaining distance d_remaining to be covered by the object using d_remaining = L1 - d, resulting in d_remaining = 4 m.
Calculate the work done by the frictional force W using W = f * d_remaining, resulting in W = 36 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 36 J.
